Articles.Content:
Nova and I created something special to remember a space hero. I believe you've seen before Nova's memorial in the forum, and I hope you go to the Mun in the next release and salute a fallen hero. There's also his kerbal personification and homage called Neil "Armstrong" Kerman.

Thanks for being our inspiration Neil.

You can see the post in our Tumblr

http://kerbaldevteam.tumblr.com/
Sadness.....
An excellent way to remember him, thanks very much for taking the time to do this.

Great way to remember him, too bad NASA got budget cuts ect. on these types of missions.

Kurtjmac also made something special.
Can we get an orbital map view pic of where it is, so we can find it when the update goes live? I feel like this should be less of a "easter egg" find and more of a "pay your respects" mission.

I'm very glad to see this. I was wondering how he would be remembered in KSP. This is good, I think. A memorial at the Tranquility landing site, and a Neil Kerman. I'll feel a little twang every time he comes up in the astronaut rotation.

A painting in honor of Commander Neil Armstrong

Thank you Nova and danRosas for building a memorial in honor of one of our greatest explorers.

Can we get an orbital map view pic of where it is, so we can find it when the update goes live? I feel like this should be less of a "easter egg" find and more of a "pay your respects" mission.

0.674 N, 23.473 E. i think that's plenty of info, i'm sure Neil would have preferred people put a bit of effort put into it.

awesome work guy's, can't wait to send a mission.
Will Neil 'Armstrong' Kerman be in the game as a possible crewmember, or did you make just the picture? I ask because Nova mentioned he removed the name Neil from the list of kerbalnauts.
Are you planning on making a memorial for every astronaut that dies, i.e. making an Astronaut cemetary
Wow this is nice. Thanks for making this Nova and Dan.
What a fitting homage to this great man. Thanks Nova and danRosas.

I was just about to suggest exactly this ( a memorial stone on the mun ) til i read this.

Neil Armstrong did the second most awesomst thing I can imagina. He united the mankind just for some moments and forever.

It is a great loss for anyone who apresheats space in any manner whatsoever. And for thous of us who adore space this is plainly an earth shattering loss. I love this Idea. And i cant wait to get the new version of kerbal so i can have him with good old Jeb heading back out to the moon.
Neil Kerman the only kerman so far with 100% unhelped Mun landing ability. Now and Forever God Speed Neil Armstrong!

Are you planning on making a memorial for every astronaut that dies, i.e. making an Astronaut cemetary

I'm more in favour of a memorial for every unknown astronaut, hidden somewhere on the Mun.
Your a hero!
I cried at the end.
I've also made a cinematic video...

Moderator Comment: Please do not post the same message across different threads. One thread is enough.

Thanks you for your cooperation!
